alert.note: Alert for Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 12 at 3:08AM EST by NWS Melbourne
info.description: ...Areas of Dense Fog Developing Over the Interior Counties... At 305 AM, surface observations and satellite imagery showed areas of fog developing over western sections of Okeechobee, Osceola and Lake Counties. Visibilities were beginning to drop below one mile in a few locations, with visibilities dropping below one mile in some locations. The fog is to spread northeast into the remainder of interior central Florida, including inland Volusia County, before sunrise. If dense fog becomes widespread and dense, then an advisory will be issued. Nevertheless, the fog will continue to pose a hazard to drivers early this morning, before burning off between 8 and 9 AM. Drivers should prepare to encounter rapid reductions in visibility from locally dense fog on their morning commute. When driving in dense fog, reduce your speed, use only your low beam headlights, and leave extra following distance between your vehicle and the one in front of you.

area.areaDesc: Inland Volusia; Northern Lake County; Okeechobee; Orange; Osceola; Seminole; Southern Lake County
